item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 20-Talking NBA Draft and Free Agency W/ Zach Harper
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: So the 2014 NBA Draft came and went Thursday night and we have a bunch of brand new faces in the league hoping to make their mark. Did anyone win the draft? Who fared worse or better between the Celtics and Lakers? The Knicks and Nets actually got picks, did it matter? I break down the draft and talk some Fre [...]
item.content:encoded: So the 2014 NBA Draft came and went Thursday night and we have a bunch of brand new faces in the league hoping to make their mark. Did anyone win the draft? Who fared worse or better between the Celtics and Lakers? The Knicks and Nets actually got picks, did it matter? I break down the draft and talk some Free Agency w/ Zach Harper of CBS Sports. Zach as always is a great guest, and we continue on chatting about the LeBron sweepstakes, who’s getting Carmelo, Knicks philosophies, Sixers philosophies, Kevin Love as well. As always you can check this podcast here or on Itunes. Thanks everyone for continuing to listen!
item.itunes:subtitle: So the 2014 NBA Draft came and went Thursday night and we have a bunch of brand new faces in the league hoping to make ...
item.itunes:summary: So the 2014 NBA Draft came and went Thursday night and we have a bunch of brand new faces in the league hoping to make their mark. Did anyone win the draft? Who fared worse or better between the Celtics and Lakers? The Knicks and Nets actually got picks, did it matter? I break down the draft and talk some Free Agency w/ Zach Harper of CBS Sports. Zach as always is a great guest, and we continue on chatting about the LeBron sweepstakes, who's getting Carmelo, Knicks philosophies, Sixers philosophies, Kevin Love as well. As always you can check this podcast here or on Itunes. Thanks everyone for continuing to listen!
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

media:content.media:title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 20-Talking NBA Draft and Free Agency W/ Zach Harper

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 19- NBA Trades and Free Agency W/ Rafael Canton
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: So I guess the NBA offseason has really started to pick up! The Knicks and Mavericks have a deal that seems to be going through involving Tyson Chandler and Raymond Felton going to the Mavericks for Jose Calderon, Shane Larkin, Samuel Dalembert, 2 2nd round picks and Wayne Ellington. It’s the 1st trade of the Phil Jackson era, and what will come of it? On the podcast today Rafael Canton of NBA Trades came on t [...]
item.content:encoded:
So I guess the NBA offseason has really started to pick up! The Knicks and Mavericks have a deal that seems to be going through involving Tyson Chandler and Raymond Felton going to the Mavericks for Jose Calderon, Shane Larkin, Samuel Dalembert, 2 2nd round picks and Wayne Ellington. It’s the 1st trade of the Phil Jackson era, and what will come of it? On the podcast today Rafael Canton of NBA Trades came on to discuss the deal and what it means for the Knicks and does this signal the end of Melo as a Knick?

Also we discussed the rest of Free Agency, who fits better for Melo, the Bulls or Rockets? Included is chat on the Heat and what LeBron James will do along with Wade and Bosh, the Kevin Love situation, and Raf’s favorite draft night trades. Take a listen, and many thanks to Raf for coming on, fun conversation as usual. You can listen to this podcast here or go on Itunes to check it out.

It's the 1st trade of the Phil Jackson era, and what will come of it? On the podcast today Rafael Canton of NBA Trades came on to discuss the deal and what it means for the Knicks and does this signal the end of Melo as a Knick?Also we discussed the rest of Free Agency, who fits better for Melo, the Bulls or Rockets? Included is chat on the Heat and what LeBron James will do along with Wade and Bosh, the Kevin Love situation, and Raf's favorite draft night trades. Take a listen, and many thanks to Raf for coming on, fun conversation as usual. You can listen to this podcast here or go on Itunes to check it out.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 18- Knicks and Finals Talk W/ Ian Begley & Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the NBA Finals continue with the Spurs and the Heat there’s plenty to talk about in that series as it advances to it’s 4th game. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal comes on to discuss the Spurs historic 1st half in Game 3, Miami’s chances to win this series and of course the rumors of Carmelo A [...]
item.content:encoded: As the NBA Finals continue with the Spurs and the Heat there’s plenty to talk about in that series as it advances to it’s 4th game. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal comes on to discuss the Spurs historic 1st half in Game 3, Miami’s chances to win this series and of course the rumors of Carmelo Anthony going to Miami and how legit it may be. We also talk some Knicks. In addition, Ian Begley of ESPN NY.com comes on to talk about the Knicks hiring of Derek Fisher and what’s next for the franchise as far as the roster is concerned. Many thanks to both gentlemen, you can listen to this podcast here or on Itunes.
item.itunes:subtitle: As the NBA Finals continue with the Spurs and the Heat there's plenty to talk about in that series as it advances to it's 4th ...
item.itunes:summary: As the NBA Finals continue with the Spurs and the Heat there's plenty to talk about in that series as it advances to it's 4th game. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal comes on to discuss the Spurs historic 1st half in Game 3, Miami's chances to win this series and of course the rumors of Carmelo Anthony going to Miami and how legit it may be. We also talk some Knicks. In addition, Ian Begley of ESPN NY.com comes on to talk about the Knicks hiring of Derek Fisher and what's next for the franchise as far as the roster is concerned. Many thanks to both gentlemen, you can listen to this podcast here or on Itunes.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

media:content.media:title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 18- Knicks and Finals Talk W/ Ian Begley & Chris Herring

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 17-NBA Water Cooler Talk W/ Sean Grande
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the conference finals are on a hiatus, I decided to call up my buddy who happens to be the radio voice of the Boston Celtics. Sean Grande joins me to talk about both series as they go and whether OKC has a chance to come back and how long will the Miami/Indiana battle go. We also discuss the draft lottery, what the Celtics may do with their draft picks, Kevin Love, and more on the future of the Celtics. In addition, there [...]
item.content:encoded: As the conference finals are on a hiatus, I decided to call up my buddy who happens to be the radio voice of the Boston Celtics. Sean Grande joins me to talk about both series as they go and whether OKC has a chance to come back and how long will the Miami/Indiana battle go. We also discuss the draft lottery, what the Celtics may do with their draft picks, Kevin Love, and more on the future of the Celtics. In addition, there was talk of a Melo/Celtics connection? Yes, that and more. Many thanks to Sean, who’s one of the best in the business. Direct link to the pod is here.
item.itunes:subtitle: As the conference finals are on a hiatus, I decided to call up my buddy who happens to be the radio voice of the Boston ...
item.itunes:summary: As the conference finals are on a hiatus, I decided to call up my buddy who happens to be the radio voice of the Boston Celtics. Sean Grande joins me to talk about both series as they go and whether OKC has a chance to come back and how long will the Miami/Indiana battle go. We also discuss the draft lottery, what the Celtics may do with their draft picks, Kevin Love, and more on the future of the Celtics. In addition, there was talk of a Melo/Celtics connection? Yes, that and more. Many thanks to Sean, who's one of the best in the business. Direct link to the pod is here.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

media:content.media:title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 17-NBA Water Cooler Talk W/ Sean Grande

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 16-NBA Playoffs and Coaching Carousel W/ Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: In one of the weirdest and controversial Game 5’s in recent memory, the Thunder defeated the Clippers and took a 3-2 lead in the best of seven western conference semifinal. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal joins me to break down the bad calls, the Clippers collapse, and we go around the NBA Playoffs plus Stan Van Gundy’s hiring in Detroit, the dance between Steve Kerr, the Knicks and Warriors, and more. As always Chris does a great job I thank him for joining me.
item.content:encoded: In one of the weirdest and controversial Game 5’s in recent memory, the Thunder defeated the Clippers and took a 3-2 lead in the best of seven western conference semifinal. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal joins me to break down the bad calls, the Clippers collapse, and we go around the NBA Playoffs plus Stan Van Gundy’s hiring in Detroit, the dance between Steve Kerr, the Knicks and Warriors, and more. As always Chris does a great job I thank him for joining me.
item.itunes:subtitle: In one of the weirdest and controversial Game 5's in recent memory, the Thunder defeated the Clippers and took a 3-2 lead in the best ...
item.itunes:summary: In one of the weirdest and controversial Game 5's in recent memory, the Thunder defeated the Clippers and took a 3-2 lead in the best of seven western conference semifinal. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal joins me to break down the bad calls, the Clippers collapse, and we go around the NBA Playoffs plus Stan Van Gundy's hiring in Detroit, the dance between Steve Kerr, the Knicks and Warriors, and more. As always Chris does a great job I thank him for joining me.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 14-Previewing the Pacers and NBA Playoffs W/ Chris Denari
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: There’s nothing like the NBA Playoffs, and they begin Saturday with a 4 game slate. The Indiana Pacers after a very long season secured homecourt advantage throughout the Eastern playoffs and are poised to make a run at the Finals. That hasn’t come without it’s challenges though. Since the all star break, the team has had struggles on the court and as a unit. The chemistry has come into question, the play has been mediocre, and downright awful at times, but here they are hosting the Atlanta Hawks Saturday at 7pm. I bring in the tv voice of the Pacers Chris Denari from Fox Sports Indiana in to discuss the team’s struggles since the all star break, particularly Roy Hibbert, what the mindset of the team is going into the postseason, and how they’ll fare against Atlanta. We also will touch on the rest of the [...]
item.content:encoded:
There’s nothing like the NBA Playoffs, and they begin Saturday with a 4 game slate. The Indiana Pacers after a very long season secured homecourt advantage throughout the Eastern playoffs and are poised to make a run at the Finals. That hasn’t come without it’s challenges though. Since the all star break, the team has had struggles on the court and as a unit. The chemistry has come into question, the play has been mediocre, and downright awful at times, but here they are hosting the Atlanta Hawks Saturday at 7pm. I bring in the tv voice of the Pacers Chris Denari from Fox Sports Indiana in to discuss the team’s struggles since the all star break, particularly Roy Hibbert, what the mindset of the team is going into the postseason, and how they’ll fare against Atlanta. We also will touch on the rest of the East and can the Pacers get to the Finals.

Special thanks to Chris for joining me, and you can listen to this podcast here. Enjoy, more previews will be up later.
item.itunes:subtitle: There's nothing like the NBA Playoffs, and they begin Saturday with a 4 game slate. The Indiana Pacers after a very long season secured homecourt ...
item.itunes:summary: There's nothing like the NBA Playoffs, and they begin Saturday with a 4 game slate. The Indiana Pacers after a very long season secured homecourt advantage throughout the Eastern playoffs and are poised to make a run at the Finals. That hasn't come without it's challenges though. Since the all star break, the team has had struggles on the court and as a unit. The chemistry has come into question, the play has been mediocre, and downright awful at times, but here they are hosting the Atlanta Hawks Saturday at 7pm. I bring in the tv voice of the Pacers Chris Denari from Fox Sports Indiana in to discuss the team's struggles since the all star break, particularly Roy Hibbert, what the mindset of the team is going into the postseason, and how they'll fare against Atlanta. We also will touch on the rest of the East and can the Pacers get to the Finals.Special thanks to Chris for joining me, and you can listen to this podcast here. Enjoy, more previews will be up later.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 13- The disaster that is the New York Knicks W/ Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: After a historical defeat in Los Angeles as the Lakers hung up a team record 51 points in the third quarter en route to a 31 point victory against the New York Knicks as the Knic [...]
item.content:encoded: After a historical defeat in Los Angeles as the Lakers hung up a team record 51 points in the third quarter en route to a 31 point victory against the New York Knicks as the Knicks head closer and closer to playoff elimination. What an awful stretch for the Knicks going back to their loss to Cleveland this past Sunday, and as they head to their impending doom, I bring in Chris Herring from the Wall Street Journal to discuss what the hell happened in Los Angeles, Phil Jackson and his thoughts on the Knicks plus them going forward, and a look at Heat/Pacers in the stretch run. You can listen to the podcast here or check out AC’S Spotlight on Itunes. Special thanks to Chris for joining me on the program.
item.itunes:subtitle: After a historical defeat in Los Angeles as the Lakers hung up a team record 51 points in the third quarter en route to a ...
item.itunes:summary: After a historical defeat in Los Angeles as the Lakers hung up a team record 51 points in the third quarter en route to a 31 point victory against the New York Knicks as the Knicks head closer and closer to playoff elimination. What an awful stretch for the Knicks going back to their loss to Cleveland this past Sunday, and as they head to their impending doom, I bring in Chris Herring from the Wall Street Journal to discuss what the hell happened in Los Angeles, Phil Jackson and his thoughts on the Knicks plus them going forward, and a look at Heat/Pacers in the stretch run. You can listen to the podcast here or check out AC'S Spotlight on Itunes. Special thanks to Chris for joining me on the program.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

media:content.media:title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 13- The disaster that is the New York Knicks W/ Chris Herring

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 12- Raymond Felton/Knicks, Yankees/Mets w/ Jake Brown
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the season turns from bad to worse for the New York Knicks as their season continues be a disappointment, things took another turn for the bizarre and terrible as Raymond Felton was arrested Tuesday morning and charged with 2 counts of weapon possession. I’m no lawyer, but the simplest and succinct thing I can say is things aren’t going good for Raymond Felton right now. How does this situation affect the Knicks? Will Carmelo leave, and where will he go? A lot of questions, and to wonder with me on the show is Jake Brown, who is the host of the Weekend with Jake & Drew for ESPN New Hampshire. We debate the Felton situation and try and make sense of what type of season the Knicks have had.
item.content:encoded:
As the season turns from bad to worse for the New York Knicks as their season continues be a disappointment, things took another turn for the bizarre and terrible as Raymond Felton was arrested Tuesday morning and charged with 2 counts of weapon possession. I’m no lawyer, but the simplest and succinct thing I can say is things aren’t going good for Raymond Felton right now. How does this situation affect the Knicks? Will Carmelo leave, and where will he go? A lot of questions, and to wonder with me on the show is Jake Brown, who is the host of the Weekend with Jake & Drew for ESPN New Hampshire. We debate the Felton situation and try and make sense of what type of season the Knicks have had.

On a brighter note, the baseball season is almost upon us. Both New York teams are in Florida training for the marathon 162, and we’ll handicap both franchises as they prepare for the season. Are the Yankees on a championship level? Should the Mets have done more to improve their franchise? Listen here to Jake and myself talk these subjects. Special thanks to Jake for joining me on the program.

Will Carmelo leave, and where will he go? A lot of questions, and to wonder with me on the show isJake Brown, who is the host of the Weekend with Jake & Drew for ESPN New Hampshire. We debate the Felton situation and try and make sense of what type of season the Knicks have had.On a brighter note, the baseball season is almost upon us. Both New York teams are in Florida training for the marathon 162, and we'll handicap both franchises as they prepare for the season. Are the Yankees on a championship level? Should the Mets have done more to improve their franchise? Listen here to Jake and myself talk these subjects. Special thanks to Jake for joining me on the program.
item.itunes:author: Anthony Canton III

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 11-NBA Trade Deadline w/ Rafael Canton
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: Continuing the Trade Deadline talk, NBA Trades’ Rafael rolls through to talk about what happened before the NBA trade deadline including the Danny Granger deal for Evan Turner. They talk the nuts and bolts of the deadline, including tanking, and the Lakers and Knicks future.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 10- Talking Knicks and Trade Deadline With Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the trade deadline has come and gone how come the Knicks didn’t make any moves? AC talks with Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal about this and more about the current state of the franchise and also analyze how the new CBA has changed the way teams make trades.
item.content:encoded: As the trade deadline has come and gone how come the Knicks didn’t make any moves? AC talks with Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal about this and more about the current state of the franchise and also analyze how the new CBA has changed the way teams make trades.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 9-Talking Hoops W/ Rafael Canton
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.content:encoded: As the NBA gets ready to head to the all star break in New Orleans, I felt it was only appropriate to go around the league and who better to go around the league with Rafael Canton. In an hour of topics, we discussed everything from Indiana’s great season to the all star break, the Western Conference contenders and the disasters in Cleveland, Detroit, and the Knicks. Rafael always does a tremendous job, and we continue the fun NBA discussion we usually enjoy. Check it out here.

Rafael always does a tremendous job, and we continue the fun NBA discussion we usually enjoy. Check it out here.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 8-Talking Hoops W/ Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the New York Knicks hit the halfway point of their season on Monday against the Nets as they continue to struggle, I decided to warm up the vocal cords again and do a podcast with Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal who does such a tremendous job covering the team. We had to hit everything on the team, including why Mike Woodson stays with the big lineups and why he’s so stubborn. In addition we discussed Iman Shumpert’s struggles and why they’ve been so frequent. A lot of great talk continues with the Knicks point guard play or lack thereof, Melo, the chemistry of the team and where they might end up.
item.content:encoded:
As the New York Knicks hit the halfway point of their season on Monday against the Nets as they continue to struggle, I decided to warm up the vocal cords again and do a podcast with Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal who does such a tremendous job covering the team. We had to hit everything on the team, including why Mike Woodson stays with the big lineups and why he’s so stubborn. In addition we discussed Iman Shumpert’s struggles and why they’ve been so frequent. A lot of great talk continues with the Knicks point guard play or lack thereof, Melo, the chemistry of the team and where they might end up. 

We conclude the chat with more on the NBA season and some of the better storylines, including thoughts on the collision course Indiana and Miami are on.  Stay tuned for more podcasts/posts from yours truly. Special thanks to Chris Herring for a great Knicks chat.

In addition we discussed Iman Shumpert's struggles and why they've been so frequent. A lot of great talk continues with the Knicks point guard play or lack thereof, Melo, the chemistry of the team and where they might end up.We conclude the chat with more on the NBA season and some of the better storylines, including thoughts on the collision course Indiana and Miami are on. Stay tuned for more podcasts/posts from yours truly. Special thanks to Chris Herring for a great Knicks chat.

item.title: AC’s Spotlight Episode 7 Part 1- Talking Hoops w/ Jonathan Tjarks of RealGM
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: So the AC’S Spotlight podcast returns with plenty of hoops talk as the NBA season continues. Jonathan Tjarks of RealGM and SB Nation came on to discuss the NBA and particularly the Knicks and Nets and their early season struggles. Will Iman Shumpert finally get traded? Can both the Knicks and Nets rebound from bad starts? Fascinating discussion here as well as the Eastern Conference and more.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 7 Pt. 2- Talking Hoops with Zach Harper
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: The NBA chat continues with me as Zach Harper& [...]
item.content:encoded: The NBA chat continues with me as Zach Harper from CBS Sports comes back to talk the association. We go through what’s gone down thus far including Portland’s hot start, the Timberwolves good start, and some of the fake Knick trade rumors that have come about thus far. Pay attention to the Knicks stuff, we kill them. We also go around the league and discuss many topics including the Pacers hot start, Miami managing the season, and San Antonio continuing to churn out wins.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 6-Talking Celtics/Tanking and more W/ Sean Grande
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: The round of NBA podcasts continue with me as I turned over to Boston and talked Celtics w/ their Radio play by play man Sean Grande as the Celtics go into their rebuilding season. Starting off 1-4 how is new head coach Brad Stevens handling the struggles? We talk about the mood in the locker room as far as the comments from Gerald Wallace and Jeff Green were received. We also discussed tanking and why it’s not always guaranteed. To close Sean told some stories about the Red Sox season and their world championship win. You can check this podcast out here, and on Itunes as well. Keep listening!

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 5- Talking Pacers w/ Quinn Buckner
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: The Indiana Pacers have gotten off to a 5-0 start for the first time in franchise history. They’re also the 1st team since 1949 to win their first 5 games without scoring 100 points. After last season’s Eastern Conference Finals appearance, the Pacers are trying to take the next step in their quest to a 1st NBA title. To breakdown the Pacers and their title chances I brought in former NBA champion Quinn Buckner to talk about it. Quinn currently does color commentary for the Indiana Pacers on Fox Sports Indiana. Quinn’s 10 year career spanned stops in Boston, Milwaukee, and Indiana. I thank him and the Pacers organization for letting me have an opportunity to pick his brain on the NBA. Take a listen and enjoy this podcast.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 4 Talking New York Knicks & NBA with Chris Herring
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: As the 2013-2014 NBA season is set to begin, AC returns to the scene to discuss a little New York Knicks basketball. Chris Herring of the Wall Street Journal joins AC to breakdown the Knicks season. Can they contend for a championship? How will coach Mike Woodson deal with lineups and new players? Carmelo is in a walk year, how will he play? There’s some new faces on the roster, how will they gel? Chris and AC break it all down.

item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 3 Part II- NBA talk continued with Rafael Canton
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: In Part I, Rafael Canton came on to discuss the Eastern Conference contenders with AC. In Part II, Rafael and AC break down the Western Conference contenders. Can the Spurs make another run? How will Houston and Dwight Howard gel together? Does OKC have enough to get back to the Finals? Western Conference talk and a bit of Cavs Wizards talk as well.
item.content:encoded: In Part I, Rafael Canton came on to discuss the Eastern Conference contenders with AC. In Part II, Rafael and AC break down the Western Conference contenders. item.title: AC’S Spotlight Episode 3 Part I-Hoops Cooler Talk With Rafael Canton
item.dc:creator: acsspotlight
item.description: AC brings in his bro Rafael (Founder of NBA Trades) to talk NBA as the season gets closer. In the 1st of a 2 part conversation, they talk the Eastern Conference contenders. Can Miami get to an unprecedented 4th Finals in a row and what could prevent them from that? How about Indiana and Chicago, are they ready to unseat the champs? They also talk about the New York teams and whether they’ll be in the mix.
